channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-22985] Failed compaction always throws TxnAbortedException
item.description:
If compaction fails, its txn is aborted, however Worker attempts to commit it again in a finally statement. This results in a TxnAbortedException [1] thrown from TxnHandler#commitTxn

We need to add a check and only try to commit at the end if the txn is not aborted.(TxnHandler#commitTxn does nothing if txn is already committed.)

[1]

ERROR org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.RetryingHMSHandler - TxnAbortedException(message:Transaction txnid:16 already aborted)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.txn.TxnHandler.raiseTxnUnexpectedState(TxnHandler.java:4843)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.txn.TxnHandler.commitTxn(TxnHandler.java:1141)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.HiveMetaStore$HMSHandler.commit_txn(HiveMetaStore.java:8101)
...
	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.txn.compactor.Worker.commitTxn(Worker.java:291)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.txn.compactor.Worker.run(Worker.java:269)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12995738 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

klcopp: I am not a big fan of sending an extra HMS call just to make sure that the transaction is aborted, or not. Shouldn't we just "unset" the compactorTxnId when aborted?

Thanks,

Peter
Hi pvary, thanks for taking a look! Of course, just uploaded patch 2 with that solution. I am a little more nervous about covering all possible situations though...

klcopp: What happens when we miss some case? The exception is thrown, and logged, and the Houskeeper thread will clean up transactions without hearthbeat. Am I right?

Thanks,

Peter
pvary That's correct, a TxnAbortedException is logged if we missed a case, that's all.
